definitions.definition: Reduced form of ' so that ', used to express purpose ; in order that .
examples: I got an earlier train to work so I'd have plenty of time to prepare for the meeting.
Eat your broccoli so you can have dessert.

definitions.definition: As a result; for that reason; therefore ; because of this; due to this.
examples: I was hungry, so I asked if there was any more food.
He ate too much cake and so he fell ill.
He wanted a book, so he went to the library.
“I need to go to the bathroom.” ― “ So go!”

definitions.definition: Used to connect previous conversation or events to the following question.
examples: So how does this story end?

definitions.definition: Used to introduce a rhetorical question.
examples: “We'd like to visit but I don't know if we can afford a hotel.” — “ So who's staying in a hotel? Stay with us.”

definitions.definition: Provided that; on condition that; as long as.

main_definition: Reduced form of ' so that ', used to express purpose ; in order that .
secondary_definitions: As a result; for that reason; therefore ; because of this; due to this.
Used to connect previous conversation or events to the following question.
Used to introduce a rhetorical question.
( archaic ) Provided that; on condition that; as long as.
